qas.question: What script is only used in artistic seals?
What script is the oldest and still in use today?
Who work in the style of carving a traditional seal in the script?

context: The Shang dynasty oracle bone script and the Zhou dynasty scripts found on Chinese bronze inscriptions are no longer used; the oldest script that is still in use today is the <a1_0>Seal<a1_0/> Script (篆書(书), zhuànshū). It evolved organically out of the Spring and Autumn period Zhou script, and was adopted in a standardized form under the first Emperor of China, Qin Shi Huang. The <a0_0>seal<a0_0/> script, as the name suggests, is now used only in artistic seals. Few people are still able to read it effortlessly today, although the art of carving a traditional seal in the script remains alive; some <a2_0>calligraphers<a2_0/> also work in this style.
